isis.stitle: HOOD, GRILLE, FENDERS AND BUMPER - 7000 - REMOVE AND INSTALL - FENDERS

svcsubproc.title: FENDERS - REMOVE
svcsubproc.para: The 7000 Series fender assemblies are comprised of multiple components: the air intake frame, the upper fender section, the wheel well opening " valance", headlights, clearance lights and lower hood latch. To remove the valance and headlight assemblies; the grille and shroud should be removed first. The fender sections consist of three separate assemblies, the fender top section, the fender extension and the valance. The valance depending on chassis configuration, is supplied in two different variations. The standard for 7300 series is the set forward axle, the variation for 7400, 7500 and 7600 chassis can be either valance assembly ( Figure 9, Item 4 and 5).

figure.caption: Figure 38. Fender Assembly And Related Parts (Drivers Side Shown)

svcsubproc.title: FENDER LOWER SECTION - REMOVE
svcsubproc.para: The 7000 Series fender upper section is bonded to the hood assembly. The lower fender section or "valance" encapsulates the headlight housing and wheel well. The Valance is a separate assembly and can be removed. The 7000 series valance may be one of two valance assemblies available. The valance for the 7300 series chassis is the shorter version due to the set forward axle application. The 7400 and 7500 may have either the set back or set forward axle depending on the chassis application. Check the axle location to determine which valance is applicable. The 7600 series valance has a set forward axle application which requires a shorter valance assembly ( Figure 9, Items 4 and 5).

figure.caption: Figure 39. Valance and Spacer Panels (Spacer Panels 7600 only)

step1.para: Locate the valance mounting bolts under headlight housing and fender assembly.
Loosen and remove the valance mounting screws from the mounting tabs.

svcsubproc.title: Fender Valance and Wheel Well Fenderette- Remove

step1.para: Remove the valance mounting screws located in the mounting holes along the inside flange between the fender flange and the valance flange assembly.
Wheel well fenderette removal, (if supplied) refer to Figure 66.

step2.para: Locate mounting bolts and nut along valance and fender extension.
Loosen and remove forward fenderette section bolts with hood tilted.
Remove rear section bolts and nuts.
Follow the same procedure for the opposite side fenderette removal.

step1.para: Beginning with the valance assembly, locate the mounting holes in the fender flange. Align the valance assembly mounting holes ( Figure 39, Item 2) in position with the holes in the fender flange.
Align the valance and headlight assembly lower mounting holes and insert the mounting screws into the valance and headlight assembly.
If the vehicle is supplied with optional wheel well fenderettes, follow procedures:

step2.para: Align the rear fenderette mounting hole with mounting holes in fender extension.
Insert mounting bolts and tighten as required.
Place forward fenderette at valance and align mounting holes.
Insert bolts and tighten as required.

step1.para: Follow same procedure for opposite side valance and fenderette install.
